name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoate has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius due to the presence of a phenyl group, which increases the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
